mapper.sql: id, role_name, description, firm_id, created, modified
mapper.update:
update role
role_name = #{roleName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
description = #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
firm_id = #{firmCode,jdbcType=BIGINT},
created = #{created,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
modified = #{modified,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}
mapper.select: select COUNT(id) from user_role ur where ur.role_id=#{value}

(SELECT m.id AS treeId,m.parent_id AS parentId, m.system_id AS systemId,m.`name`,m.description,1 AS menu,m.type FROM menu m where m.`type` <=1 order by m.order_number asc) UNION ALL SELECT r.id AS treeId,r.menu_id AS parentId,NULL AS systemId,r.`name`,r.description,0 AS menu,'3' as type FROM resource r

(SELECT DISTINCT m.id AS treeId,m.parent_id AS parentId, m.system_id AS systemId,m.`name`,m.description,1 AS menu,m.type FROM menu m, role_menu rm, user_role ur where m.id = rm.menu_id and rm.role_id = ur.role_id and m.`type` <=1 and ur.user_id = #{userId} order by m.order_number asc) UNION ALL SELECT DISTINCT r.id AS treeId,r.menu_id AS parentId,NULL AS systemId,r.`name`,r.description,0 AS menu,'3' as type FROM resource r, role_resource rr, user_role ur where r.id = rr.resource_id and rr.role_id = ur.role_id and ur.user_id = #{userId};
SELECT rm.menu_id AS treeId,1 AS menu FROM role_menu rm where role_id=#{value} UNION ALL SELECT rr.resource_id AS treeId, 0 AS menu FROM role_resource rr where role_id=#{value}
select r.* from user_role ur LEFT JOIN role r on ur.role_id=r.id where ur.user_id = #{userId}
